intro: Fagelia linearis, commonly known as the slender sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its bark is smooth and gray, becoming fissured with age. Fagelia linearis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
